SEARCH
Package com.glamdring.greenZenith.userInteractions.users

Class User

java.lang.Object
com.glamdring.greenZenith.externals.database.GZDBSuperManager
com.glamdring.greenZenith.userInteractions.users.User
All Implemented Interfaces:
Attributable, Killable, Serializable
public class User extends GZDBSuperManager implements Attributable, Killable, Serializable
Represents a User of the application, with it's respective attributes, allowing the creation, modification and deletion of it, as well as being the central piece of interaction of the entire application, allowing for access and control od the plants, products and cart.
Since:
0.1
Version:
1.6.0
See Also:
  • GZDBSuperManager
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      public User(int id) throws InvalidUserException, GZDBResultException
      Retrieves the information from the database utilizing only the ID, and assigns the results to each correspondant field.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier that corresponds to a certain User registry on the database.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the ID is not valid.
      GZDBResultException - If the database connection cannot be resolved or the default images cannot be loaded.

    • User

      public User(String email, String password) throws InvalidUserException, GZDBResultException
      Retrieves the information from the database utilizing the correspondant email and password of a User, and assigns the results to each correspondant field.
      Parameters:
      email - The unique email that corresponds to the account.
      password - The password taht is used to access the account.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the email or passwords are not valid.
      GZDBResultException - If the database connection cannot be resolved or the default images cannot be loaded.

    • User

      public User(String username, String email, String password, int age, BufferedImage profilePicture) throws InvalidUserException, GZDBResultException
      Creates a new user with the determined input parameters, it has to follow the established format.
      Parameters:
      username - The desired unique name of a user.
      email - The selected unique email associated with the account.
      password - The password requiered to access the account.
      age - The age in real life of the owner of the account.
      profilePicture - A picture of the person in real life.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the data provided does not meet the format requirements or the default images cannot be loaded.
      GZDBResultException - If the database connection cannot be resolved.

    • getPlant

      public Plant getPlant(int id, String name) throws InvalidUserException
      Gets a singular plant depending on the ID and confirms if it matches with the name.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the plant to look for.
      name - The name of the plant to check it's validity.
      Returns:
      The plant with all of it's data.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the plant's ID and name are not correspondant or cannot be resolved correctly.

    • addPlant

      public void addPlant(String name, String description, int quantity, LocalDate plantingDate, ArrayList<LocalTime> schedule, BufferedImage plantPicture) throws InvalidUserException
      Adds a plant to this User's plant list and maps.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new plant to be added.
      description - The description of the new plant to be added.
      quantity - The quantity of the new plant to be added.
      plantingDate - The date the new plant was planted.
      schedule - The schedule to water the new plant to be added.
      plantPicture - The representative in real life picture of the new plant to be added.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the plant's ID and name are not correspondant or cannot be resolved correctly.

    • updatePlant

      public void updatePlant(int id, String oldName, String newName, Date newPantingDate, String newDescription, int newQuantity, ArrayList<Time> newSchedule, BufferedImage newPlantPicture) throws InvalidUserException
      Updates an already existing plant with the new provided data.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the plant to look for.
      oldName - The original name of the plant to check for it's validity.
      newName - The new name for this plant.
      newPantingDate - The new date this plant was planted on.
      newDescription - The new description of this plant.
      newQuantity - The new quantity of this plant.
      newSchedule - The new schedule of this plant.
      newPlantPicture - The new picture of this plant in real life.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the plant's ID and name are not correspondant or cannot be resolved correctly.

    • deletePlant

      public void deletePlant(int id, String name) throws InvalidUserException
      Deletes a certain plant that this user posseses.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the plant to look for.
      name - The name of the plant to check it's validity.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the plant's ID and name are not correspondant.

    • updateUserBatch

      public String updateUserBatch(String newName, String newEmail, int newAge, BufferedImage newPicture, String oldPassword, String newPassword)
      Updates all the user's data in a batch, if any given parameter is null it get's omitted.
      Parameters:
      newName - The new name of this user.
      newEmail - The new email associated with this user's account.
      newAge - The new age of this user.
      newPicture - The new profile picture of this user.
      oldPassword - The old password of this account to check for it's validity.
      newPassword - The new password to be associated with this account.
      Returns:
      A long message indicating the state of the batch updates, which ones failed and why, which one suscceded or if there was no updates at all.

    • setName

      private String setName(String newName) throws InvalidUserException
      Sets a new unique name for an already existing user.
      Parameters:
      newName - The new name to be used.
      Returns:
      A message providing information on the success of the update.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the new name does not meet the format requirements or the database connection cannot be resolved.

    • setAge

    • setPassword

      private String setPassword(String oldPassword, String newPassword) throws InvalidUserException
      Sets a new unique email for an already existing user if the old password is used to grant permission to make the changes.
      Parameters:
      oldPassword - The password used to access the account.
      newPassword - The new password to be used for future access.
      Returns:
      A message providing information on the success of the update.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the new age does not meet the format requirements or the database connection cannot be resolved.

    • setAdministratorAccess

      public String setAdministratorAccess(boolean newAdministratorAccess) throws InvalidUserException
      Determines whether the User has access to administrator features or not.
      Parameters:
      newAdministratorAccess - A true or false value describing the state of it's administrator access.
      Returns:
      A message providing information on the success of the update.
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - If the new age does not meet the format requirements or the database connection cannot be resolved.
